definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
the four great Chinese inventions: paper, printing, magnetic compass and gunpowder

sentences.english: All the while, making both foreign and Chinese traders very wealthy.
sentences.chinese: 这让外国和中国的商人大发横财。

sentences.english: Many companies tapped into the cheap labor of this country to make a fortune.
sentences.chinese: 许多公司利用了这个国家便宜的人工来大发利市。

sentences.english: She raged against her husband for some household affairs.
sentences.chinese: 她为一些家庭琐事对丈夫大发雷霆。

sentences.english: The runup in business school applications during the recession has created a windfall for essay writers.
sentences.chinese: 衰退期间涌现的商学院申请令论文写手大发横财。

sentences.english: As I was going through that period of financial scarcity, I prayed that I didn’t experience a cash windfall.
sentences.chinese: 在我身无分文的那段时间，我祈祷自己不会大发横财。

sentences.english: When Alex began to discuss, chaussures homme, Richard explosion into a rage.
sentences.chinese: 当阿列克斯开始争论时，理查德便大发雷霆。

sentences.english: Last night, I stomped into our bedroom ready to turn on my anger at full volume.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚，我跺着脚进卧室，准备大发雷霆。

sentences.english: That man wore a new hairpiece every day and seemed to be a big wig.
sentences.chinese: 那个人每天戴着新的假发，看起来像个大发套。

sentences.english: Example: When I told Raymand that someone has taken his candy box away, he went through the roof.
sentences.chinese: 当雷蒙德听我说他的糖果盒被人拿走的时候大发雷霆。

sentences.english: She often hits the roof because of trifles.
sentences.chinese: 她常为鸡毛蒜皮的小事大发雷霆。

sentences.english: Things are going very badly with me, nothing but a succession of vexations and fits of rage.
sentences.chinese: 我的环境很不好，除了不绝的烦恼，就是大发性情。

sentences.english: If I remember correctly, this is the eighteenth contract I've signed with Dafa Garments.
sentences.chinese: 如果我没记错的话，这是我同大发签的第十八个合同。

sentences.english: When Alex began to argue, Richard burst into a rage.
sentences.chinese: 当阿列克斯开始争论时，理查德便大发雷霆。

sentences.english: The veteran crooner took out his anger over a leaked record on a producer.
sentences.chinese: 这位老牌歌手因唱片歌曲被泄露，向制作人大发雷霆。
这引起了爱德华的醋意大发。

sentences.english: A side-opening breach also allows quicker reloading and the use of larger rounds, said Phung.
sentences.chinese: 阿方开放违反还可以更快地装填和使用大发，说奉。

definition: lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
the time comes, fortune turns (idiom); to have a lucky break/things change for the better
to fire (a weapon) in rapid succession
the year's horoscope augurs ill (idiom); an unlucky year
to surge up/to rise/(of tensions etc) to run high
to flip out/to act out violently
to have a lucky stroke/to try one's luck
